characters: DANCES IN ORDER OF APPEARANCE IN THE FILM
BOB AND SHIRLEY IN CAR. NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of HEAVY RIVETED IRON DOORS with round handles covered by spider webs. Two "GIANTS", wearing leopard-skin shorts, iron bicep-ban headbands, pull the heavy iron doors open revealing the INTERIOR of the MAUSOLEUM.  There is an ornate stone sarc in the center of the room, raised up on an altar.  The ba has a mantle with a bust of the Virgin Mary looking downw the coffin.  There is a round red window in the center of wall.  A ray of red light shines through the window,  illuminating the misty fog hanging in the air. The giants walk into the Mausoleum.  They lift the heavy lid off of the coffin, revealing CRISWELL.  He is lying i coffin on his back, with his arms crossed over his chest eyes closed.  He is wearing black suit pants, a white shi black ribbon-like bow-tie, and a black satin cape.

dialogues.speaker: CRISWELL
dialogues.text: We see CRISWELL, Narrator of our tale and SOLE RULER OF T DARK WORLD, now sitting upright, slouching somewhat in hi coffin, glancing offscreen (at his cue card). During his monologue, each time Criswell looks up at the a DRAMATIC PAUSE is inserted as he then looks back down a cue card and searches for his place in order to continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Criswell!  For years I have  told the almost unbelievable,  related the unreal, and shown it  to be more...than a fact.  Now I tell a tale of the  threshold, people, so astounding that some of you may faint.

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEYARD SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: SHOT of an ancient TOMBSTONE, surrounded by fog, with a human SKULL sitting at its base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of BLACK RAVEN with thick fog swirling around it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another tombstone, with a cherub-like engraving on the fr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plaque-like grave stone on the ground with fog swirling over it, a Skull and a long bone sitting on the ground by CRISWELL (Voice Over) This is a story of those in  the twilight time...once human,  now monsters, in a void between  the living and the dead.   Monsters to be pitied, monsters  to be despised...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL (continuing) A night with the Ghouls...the  ghouls reborn, from the  innnermost depths...of the  world.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN TITLES
dialogues.text: TITLES are superimposed over a still photo of a Gilded Nu Female Figure sitting on the stone altar in the MAUSOLEUM

dialogues.speaker: ASTRA PRODUCTIONS
dialogues.text: presents CRISWELL in

dialogues.speaker: ORGY OF THE DEAD
dialogues.text: Copyright by Astra Productions 1965 starring

dialogues.speaker: FAWN SILVER
dialogues.text: as Black Ghoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Shirley WILLIAM BATES as Bob featuring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gold Girl Dance...........PAT BARRINGER Hawaiian Dance.............MICKEY JINES Skeleton Dance...........BARBARA NORDIN Indian Dance...............BUNNY GLASER Slave Dance..............NADEJDA DOBREV Street Walker Dance......COLEEN O'BRIEN Cat Dance...................TEXAS STARR Fluff Dance................RENE DE BEAU Mexican Dance...........STEPHANIE JONES Zombie Dance...............DENE STARNES Mummy.......................LOUIS OJENA Wolf Man...................JOHN ANDREWS Doctor...................EDWARD TONTINI Second Doctor............WILLIAM BONNER Giants....................ROD LINDEMANN Detective...................JOHN BEALEY Nurse....................ARLENE SPOONER Costumes.................ROBERT DARIEUX Art Director.............ROBERT LATHROP Sets..................ERNEST BOUVENKAMP Sound.......................DALE KNIGHT Assistant Cameraman......ROBERT MAXWELL Make-up.................MARGARET DAVIES Hairdresser..............NANCY SANDOVAL Choreographer..................MARC DESMOND Still Photographer............ROBERT WILSON Production Supervisor..........TAD STAFFORD Post Production Supervisor..DONALD A. DAVIS Color.........................EASTMAN COLOR Processing.....CONSOLIDATED FILM INDUSTRIES Screenplay by

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his novel "Orgy of the Dead" Director of Cinematography ROBERT CARAMICO Associate Producers

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM BATES
dialogues.text: L.S. JENSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Produced and Directed by

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CONVERTIBLE is driving along a DESERT ROAD.  LONG SHOTS the automobile driving are filmed in bright sunlight.  Th desert hills are clearly visible in the background, with a slight darkening to suggest day-for-night, but the car' headlights are on so we clearly understand that it is pit black in the dead of night.

dialogues.speaker: BOB AND SHIRLEY IN CAR. NIGHT
dialogues.text: BOB and SHIRLEY are seated in the CONVERTIBLE, driving th the night, on a "date".  They are searching for an ancien CEMETERY.  MEDIUM SHOTS have a pitch black background and shadows across the car. Shirley is leaning over in her seat toward Bob, who is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIRLEY We sure picked the wrong night to find a cemetery.  Let's turn back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB No.  It's on a night like this when the best ideas come to mind. SHIRLEY But does it have to be in a cemetery? BOB You wouldn't understand.  Seeing a cemetery on a night like this can stir in the mind the best ideas for a good horror story. SHIRLEY But there're so many wonderful things to write about, Bob. BOB Sure there are--and I've tried them all.  Plays, love stories, westerns, dog stories.  Huh,  now there was a good one, that  dog story all about-- SHIRLEY (interrupting) But horror stories!  Why all the time horror stories? BOB Shirley, I wrote for years  without selling a single word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob lets go of the wheel with his right arm and puts it a Shirley, who leans closer against him. BOB My monsters have done well for  me.  You think I'd give that up  just so I could write about  trees, or dogs, or daisies?   Huhuh--Daisies!  That's it,  I'll write about my creatures  who are pushing up the daisies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shirley looks up at Bob and smiles.  He tilts his head do they kiss. BOB Your puritan upbringing holds you back from my monsters, but it certainly doesn't hurt your art of kissing.  SHIRLEY That's life.  My kisses are alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB Who's to say my monsters  aren't alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT of the car driving down the road CUT back to MEDIUM SHOT of Bob and Shirley BOB All of my books are based on  fact, or legend.  Thats perhaps  why they're more interesting  and sell in the top spots. SHIRLEY Well, fact or not, I don't  see how we're going to find  an ancient cemetery in these  mountains tonight.  I can't  see a thing!  Let's turn back. BOB There's an old cemetery on this road. I've been there  before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT of car driving up a desert road with a sandy mountain in the background. SHIRLEY I'm getting the jitters!   Let's turn back! BOB (reluctantly) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob takes his arm from around Shirley and puts it back on wheel. BOB Just as soon as I find a  place wide enough to turn  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of CAR INTERIOR - DASHBOARD. CUT BACK TO MEDIUM SHOT - Bob and Shirley SHIRLEY Not so fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear sounds of tires squealing on the road. CLOSEUP of car wheel racing along the road. CUT BACK TO MEDIUM SHOT - Bob and Shirley SHIRLEY (desperately) Not so fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP - CAR PEDALS.  Bob steps hard on the brake, then pumps the brake repeatedly. CUT BACK TO MEDIUM SHOT - Bob and Shirley.  Shirley screa and hides her face with her hands. ZOOM IN on a high dirt bank at the roadside, then the scr swirls and spins quickly to suggest a dizzying automobile crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Shirley are lying on their backs, unconcsious, on the ground.  The ground is covered by scattered leaves Misty fog swirls over them. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shirley wakes up and sits upright groggily.  She looks  around, then looks down at Bob.  She moves toward him and cradles his head in her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cemetery is filled with fog.  We see a large stone throne framed by ornate columns, with an altar beneath it.  Ther are tombstones in the background, and skulls and bones on the ground. CAMERA PANS RIGHT across a small clearing to the MAUSOLEU CRISWELL (VO) It is said on clear nights,  beneath        the cold light of the  moon, howl the dog and the wolf,  and creeping things crawl out of the slime.  It is then the  ghouls feast in all their radiance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mausoleum doors creak open on their own, and Criswell quickly stalks out across the clearing, hiding his face  behind his long black cape which is held up with his bent elbow against his face, in Dracula fashion. CRISWELL (VO - Continuing) It is on nights like this most people prefer to steer clear of, uh, Burial Grounds. It is on  nights like this, that the  creatures are said to appear,  and to walk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criswell walks up the steps to the altar, across the alta and then sits down on the stone seat.  He then slowly low his cape from his face and regally looks off to the right (at his cue card).                    CRISWELL The day is gone, the night is upon us, and the moon, which  controls all of the underworld,  once again shines...in radiant  contentment. (beat) Come forth, come forth, o Princess of Darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criswell repeatedly beckons slowly toward himself with hi right hand, staring across the clearing at the mausoleum. The PRINCESS OF DARKNESS is standing in front of the  Mausoleum.  She walks into the clearing with an entrancin demeanor, her arms outstretched straight in front of her. She is wearing a long black low-cut dress with long open  sleeves.  The sleeves are lined with red and hang down a couple feet from her wrists.  She walks slowly over towar Criswell's throne. The Princess of Darkness stands beside Criswells throne,  crosses her forearms in front of her chest, and bows towa him.  He nods toward her.  She reaches out and places her left hand on Criswell's right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL (VO) Time seems to stand still.  Not  so the ghouls, when a night of  Pleasure is at hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criswell continues to hold the Princess of Darkness's han and she looks at him seductively. CRISWELL If I am not pleased by tonight's entertainment, I shall banish  their souls to everlasting  damnation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness again crosses her arms in front her chest and slowly bows to Criswell. CUT TO shot of the FULL MOON with dramatic cymbals crashi then back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL And who is to be first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness claps twice, summoning the first the night's entertainers.  These poor souls must dance fo Criswell's approval.  If he is pleased, they can continue entertain him for centuries, but if not, they will be ban to everlasting damnation by the All-powerful Criswell. LONG SHOT OF THE CLEARING.  Huge flames rise from the gro in front of the clearing.  The INDIAN GIRL enters the cle and begins to Dance.  She is wearing a red Native America style dress and headband. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS One who loved flames.  Her lover was killed by flames.  She died  in flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INDIAN GIRL DANCE begins. The Indian Girl dances around for awhile, then dances awa into the foggy background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob slowly wakes up and sits up.  Bob and Shirley look  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness points dramatically toward the  mausoleum and begins to speak without moving her lips!  A marvel of filmmaking art. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS  (out of sync with picture) One who prowls the lonely streets at night in life is bound to prowl  them in eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STREET WALKER DANCE begins.  The STREET WALKER walks  into the clearing wearing a pink dress and purple feather boa, and beckons with her finger as if to say, "Come here Criswell!" EXT. WOODS.  NIGHT. At the car accident scene with Bob and Shirley, slow jazz music is audible from the nearby festivities in the cemet Bob and Shirley are still sitting on the ground, looking  toward the source of the music. CRISWELL (VO) Ahh, the curiousity of youth... on the road to ruin!  May it  ever be so adventurous!  SHIRLEY I'm so frightened.  BOB Well we certainly can't stay  here. C'mon.          SHIRLEY Where?  BOB In there.  SHIRLEY It frightens me.  BOB Silly, there's nothing in  there to be afraid of.  SHIRLEY Then..then what's that music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB That's what I want to find out.   We have to get help.  SHIRLEY What help can we possibly find  in the cemetery at this time of  night?  BOB Something's making that music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIRLEY I'm not sure I care to find out what it is.  BOB All right.  Don't worry, I'll be right beside you.  SHIRLEY What help will that do if  something in there isn't dead?  BOB Not dead?  In a cemetery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIRLEY I can't imagine anything dead  playing that music.  BOB Well, it's probably just the caretaker, and that's exactly  who we want to find.  They'll  have a telephone.  C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob helps Shirley up from the ground and leads her into t thick bushes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CEMETERY, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Criswell nods repeatedly, smiling at the dancer in approv The Street Walker's clothes have suddenly disappeared. Bob and Shirley creep beneath the bushes, crouched down l They reach the edge of the clearing where Criswell and th Princess of Darkness are watching the Street Walker Dance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIRLEY Could it be some kind of  college initiation?  BOB It's an initiation all right,  but not of a college as you  and I know them.  Nothing  alive looks like that!  SHIRLEY Can't we get out of here?  BOB I'm not sure...  SHIRLEY What do you mean?  BOB I'm not sure, myself. It's  just a feeling I've had  since the crash...Like I  feel a cold chill all over.. ..Now this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Street Walker dances with a Skeleton that is hanging the door of the mausoleum. The Street Walker dance ends. CRISWELL I would see for approval, the one who in life worshipped  gold above all else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness points dramatically toward the mausoleum again to start off the next dance. The giants walk to the doors, now wearing red and white horizontal-striped miniskirts (or ancient egyptian garb?) They pull the iron doors open slowly, and we see the GOLD GIRL DANCER lying on her back on the altar inside. SHIRLEY (pointing toward the mausoleum) Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB Be careful!--They'll see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gold Girl Dancer rises slowly and seductively from th table, then stalkingly dances out into the clearing.  She wearing a metallic gold tunic-like dress. We see a shot of Bob and Shirley watching, and suddenly t Gold Girl's dress has disappeared. The Gold Girl Dance continues. CRISWELL Throw gold at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giants pick up a bucket of gold doubloons and begin  slowly sprinkling them over the Gold Girl as she dances.  She sits on the ground and reaches for the falling coins. CRISWELL More gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giants continue dropping gold coins on the Gold Girl. She picks up the gold coins, rubbing them over her body,  in ecstasy. CRISWELL (excitedly) More gold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giants continue, to the delight of Criswell.  The Gol girl tries to scoop all the scattered coins closer to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL (impatiently) More gold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giants continue.  Criswell is thrilled, and begins to LAUGH loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL (to the Princess) For all eternity, she shall  have gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness laughs in acknowledgement, then  claps her hands twice, commanding the Giants to finish th ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giants walk toward the Gold Girl, who is still on the ground playing with the gold coins and rubbing them on he body.  The giants pick up the Gold Girl, who resists, try to maintain contact with the gold.  She reaches for it as they lift her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of a BUBBLING GIANT CAULDRON full of a substance is supposed to look like gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giants dip the Gold Girl feet first into the cauldron submerging her entire body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few seconds later, the giants lift the Gold Girl out of cauldron.  Her body is now entirely gilded, and she is st They lift her onto their shoulders, carrying her like a b walking in front of Criswell's throne, then back into the mausoleum, laying her body on the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Bob and Shirley, looking dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL (VO) And both couldn't help but  remember a line from one of  Bob's stories:  "A sudden wind  howls.  The night things are  all about me.  Every shadow, a beckoning invitation...to  disaster.  I know I should  think of other things, of  pleasant things, but I can't.  How can I think of other things,  of pleasant things, when I am  in a place surrounded by  shadows and objects, which can  take any shape, here in the  darkness...Any shape my mind  can conceive."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep in the woods, we see THE WOLF MAN and THE MUMMY, wal quickly. Suddenly, Bob and Shirley are grabbed from behind by the MAN and the MUMMY.  The Wolf Man and The Mummy drag Bob a Shirley over to the clearing near Criswell's throne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness is now seated at Criswell's righ side with him on his throne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL Bring 'em in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness stands and walks to the end of t altar below Criswell's throne, then sits on the lower sea the end of the altar and crosses her legs. The Wolf Man and The Mummy drag Bob and Shirley over to t center of the clearing to face Criswell, The Sole Ruler o the Dark World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL They are live ones?  THE MUMMY (with audible tape hiss added) Yes, Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL Live ones where only the dead  should be?  THE MUMMY Yes, Master, and we caught  them, him and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mummy motions toward the Wolf Man. THE WOLF MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL You shall both be rewarded. (To Princess) My Dear Empress of the Night,  put these intruders to the  test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medium Shot of Princess of Darkness.  (Suddenly the Princ of  Darkness is beside the throne again, several feet fro seat at the foot of the altar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS But they are not yet one of us.  CRISWELL (happily) A situation easily remedied.  PRINCESS OF DARKNESS Tie them that they may watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT back to long shot of the entire throne and throne alt The Princess of        Darkness is now seated again at th the altar. The Wolf Man and The Mummy tie Bob and Shirley to very ta grave stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT to medium-close shot of Princess of Darkness, whose c is heaving excitedly as she grips the handle of the long  sacrificial dagger tucked into the belt at her waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIRLEY (desperately, to Criswell) Fiend!  Fiend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS To love the cat, is to be  the cat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criswell motions toward The Princess of Darkness, who the walks back up onto the altar and then sits down beside  Criswell again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAT GIRL DANCE begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL (jovially) A pussycat is born to be  whipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cat Girl Dance ends. CRISWELL (excitedly) It will please me very much  to see the Slave Girl with  her tortures!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO interior of the stone mausoleum.  The Ancient Egyp SLAVE GIRL is chained from her wrists to a high hook on t wall.  One of the "giants" pretends to whip her with a ca o' nine tails. CUT back to CRISWELL. CRISWELL (excitedly) Torture! Torture!  It  pleasures me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slave girl pulls with all her might and the chains  suddenly pop off the hook.  She then pushes the iron door open and dances out into the clearing. The Slave Dance concludes. SHIRLEY I'm so frightened. BOB You've got a right to be.   We're trapped by a bunch of  fiends. SHIRLEY Those creatures..! BOB Don't let them hear you. SHIRLEY What can we do? BOB I don't know.  I just don't  know. But don't give up.   We're not finished yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shirley closes her eyes and sighs. BOB Easy Shirley, Easy!  Panic  won't do us any good!  Let  me think. We've got to stall for time. SHIRLEY I'm afraid I'll faint. BOB Whatever you do, don't do  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camera zooms back and we see that the Wolf Man and Th Mummy are hiding behind Bob and Shirley.  The Wolf Man ha his hand up to his ear so he can hear what Bob and Shirle are saying. The Wolf Man and The Mummy then creep over toward Criswel throne. The Wolf Man whispers into The Princess of Darkness's ear The Mummy and Criswell watch. The Princess of Darkness gets up from the throne and walk to Shirley.  Shirley grimaces.  The Princess of Darkness  unbuttons Shirley's blouse, then marks Shirley's abdomen a red (blood?) cross using her long sharp fingernail. Shirley screams. The Princess of Darkness pulls her long dagger out of her and raises it, staring into Shirley's eyes.  Suddenly, Cr yells: CRISWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness pauses and looks back at Criswel CRISWELL Let her continue to learn.   The time is not yet right  that they should join with  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness reluctantly puts her dagger back her belt and tucks Shirley's blouse back in. The Princess of Darkness walks back to Criswell's throne. He pulls a human skull out from behind his seat. CRISWELL ...And what is this? PRINCESS OF DARKNESS A symbol, Master. CRISWELL What kind of symbol? PRINCESS OF DARKNESS She loved the bull ring  and the matador.  She  danced to their destruction. Now she dances to her own  destruction.  Her dance is of skulls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness takes the skull from Criswell an throws it dramatically into the clearing. The MEXICAN DANCE (SKULL DANCE) ensues. CRISWELL She came to us on the Day of  the Dead. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS El Dia De Los Muertos...A celebration in her country. CRISWELL                                 Her dance has pleased me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness snaps her fingers, starting the  HAWAIIAN DANCE (SNAKE DANCE). PRINCESS OF DARKNESS With the loss of her lover,  this one cast herself into  the Volcano's fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple times during the dance, there are abrupt cuts to STOCK FOOTAGE of a rattlesnake in a bright daylight shot tall dry grass.  (Looks like it was from a documentary) CRISWELL She was? PRINCESS OF DARKNESS As I said, a worshipper of  snakes, and of smoke, and  flames. CRISWELL Oh, yes, a religion of sorts. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS It would seem so, Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawaiian Dance continues, then cut to The Mummy and The W Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MUMMY I don't like snakes.  I remember  the one Cleopatra used.  Cute  little rascal until it flicked out that red tongue, and those  two sharp fangs.  You'd never  think such a little thing packed such a big wallop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WOLF MAN Aaaaahhnnnhaaaaaannnhhh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MUMMY Hurt her?  Hell, it killed her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WOLF MAN (in agreement) Aaaahhhhnnnahhhnnnggnnn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawaiian/Snake Girl continues to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MUMMY We had lots of snakes in my  ancient Egypt...slimy, slinky things.  THE WOLF MAN Aahhhhnnnaaahahnn. AaaaaahhhhoooWWWOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!  THE MUMMY When I was alive, they were the things nightmares were made of.  THE WOLF MAN Aaarrrgggaahh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hawaiian Dance ends.  CRISWELL She pleases me.  Permit her to  live in the World of the Snakes. (audible cue card flip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing, after finding his place on the next cue card Now, I will talk...to The  Wolf Man...and The Mummy. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS As you wish, Master

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness motions for The Wolf Man and The to come.  THE MUMMY         He wants us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WOLF MAN Aaahhnnnahnnnn.  THE MUMMY What do you suppose for?  THE WOLF MAN Aaaaannnnnuuunnnuhhhhh?  THE MUMMY Did you do something to get  us into trouble again?  THE WOLF MAN Aannnnaahhnn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MUMMY Did you howl off-key at  the moon again?  THE WOLF MAN Aannnnaahhnn. THE MUMMY I can't remember doing  anything wrong either. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MUMMY We better go before we  make him mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf Man and The Mummy walk over to Criswell's Throne THE MUMMY (apprehensively) We are your servants, Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf Man bows to Criswell. CRISWELL Of course you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf Man and the Mummy crouch in fear as they face Cr THE MUMMY Have we in some way made  you angry, Master? CRISWELL You know better than that. THE MUMMY We don't know of anything,  Master... CRISWELL Then why do you shake so? THE MUMMY It's not often an Emperor  like you calls on creatures  like us. CRISWELL Well rest easy, I'm not  angry with either of you. THE MUMMY (relieved) Aaaahhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mummy Sighs in relief and the Wolf Man nods. THE MUMMY Then it is some service you  desire of us. CRISWELL You are the keepers of the  Damned.  You two know them all.   And I am tired of this usual  type of entertainment. I want...a decided change. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS The moon!...is soon gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness points up at the full moon. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS There is little time left for  the remainder of the evening's  pleasures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness gets up from the seat at the end the altar and walks around beside Criswell's throne. CRISWELL Yes, yes yes I know all that. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS At the first sight of the  morning sun's rays, we must  be gone. CRISWELL I suppose most of the others  will have to wait for their  judgement until after the next  full moon. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS It would seem so, Master CRISWELL Ahh, but I declare there is  still time for something. THE MUMMY There are one or two which  should complement the night's  entertainment, Master CRISWELL Ahh, good.  Then I will  see them.  Dismiss the rest. THE MUMMY Yes, sir, Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob's hands are wiggling, trying to loosen the rope bindi his wrists behind his back around the stone column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB The ropes are coming loose.  SHIRLEY Be careful!  BOB I am--It's our only chance.  SHIRLEY Nothing is worth your life.  BOB My guess is if we don't  take the chance pretty soon, we're not going to have much life left anyway.  SHIRLEY I'm frightened.  I'm so  frightened.  BOB Hold on just a little  longer, Shirley.  SHIRLEY Be careful, oh please be  careful.  We'll never get  out of here alive, I know  it.  I just feel it.  BOB You do?  SHIRLEY Yes I feel it in my bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB You're talking nonsense.  SHIRLEY Oh, no I'm not.  These  heathens probably have  an open grave for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB They wouldn't dare put  us in the same grave-- or would they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIRLEY I should hope not.  I  hate you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB That sudden?  SHIRLEY Yes, that sudden.  If it weren't for you we wouldn't be hunting  for an old cemetery on a  night like this.  It's all your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB (dejected) ...And I thought you loved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness is leaning over, covering her mo and whispering into Criswell's ear, looking over her hand at Shirley.  CRISWELL Not yet.  I perhaps have other  plans for such a pretty one.   No matter, I will tell you when  and if you may have her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness crosses her forearms and bows to Criswell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS The Wolf Man informs me that  the next one is the woman who  murdered her husband on their  wedding night.  Now she dances with his skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SKELETON DANCE begins. The SKELETON DANCE GIRL, wearing a white dress and long  wedding veil, comes into the clearing with a skeleton.  S dances with the skeleton, then dances in the clearing for Criswell. The Skeleton Dance concludes.  CRISWELL (to Shirley) Have you not enjoyed the  evening's festivities?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shirley is silent and looks downward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL Ahh, that will soon change  when you become one of us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf Man leans back and howls.  (He tilts his head ba far his fake rubber wolfman mask comes up and you can see skin at the bottom of his neck)  THE WOLF MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAAAAAAHHGGGGGHHHHHHHhhhhhh!  CRISWELL It would seem that The  Wolf Man would have you  for his own!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIRLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL I have promised both The  Wolf Man and The Mummy a  reward.  It could be that you are that reward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIRLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL You need not worry...Not just  now, anyway.  BOB Leave her alone, you fiend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL Fiend is it!  You will not  be so fortunate.  Your  existence will cease within  moments.  No one wishes to  see a man dance... (looking at Shirley) And you, my dear, will entertain  for centuries to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB If I could get my hands on  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL ..Oh, You could do nothing! (to Shirley) I can save you much pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB Leave her alone, I tell you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL (to Shirley) I do not joke in my proposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS She is to be mine!  It is so spoken!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL The Princess of Darkness would  have you for her own to join us  through extreme pain. (beat) Yet I am inclined for one as  lovely as you, to be more lenient.  I have but to touch you with my  finger, and it would mean the end  of you, all over, quickly and  painlessly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIRLEY No. No! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL I repulse you?  Very well.  It seems you have chosen your own  fate. Live with it!  I should  say die with it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks down somberly, then looks over at Shirley. BOB I've got the ropes loose now.   I've got my hands free.  Be  careful--Don't change your  expression too much.  They  must not catch on.  SHIRLEY What can we do against them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB I don't know, yet.  We'll  just have to watch our chance.   When it comes I'll know what  to do--I hope I'll know what to do.  SHIRLEY I still don't know what ever made me go steady with a  crackpot writer like you.  BOB All right.  Put it on heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIRLEY My old boyfriend Tommy would  never have gotten me in a  mess like this.  At least he's  got brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB Him!  I'll bet he sleeps  with all the lights on. SHIRLEY Maybe so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO shot of The Mummy talking to The Wolf Man THE MUMMY I could make her another  Cleopatra... THE WOLF MAN Ahh hahahhnnn hahnnn! THE MUMMY Without the snake, of  course.                 PRINCESS OF DARKNESS (impatiently) Well? CRISWELL Ahh, she will be yours. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS (impatiently) When!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL At your discretion...But  first, I desire more  entertainment. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS The moon is almost gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL Ahh, there is yet time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS At the first sight of the  morning's rays' light...  CRISWELL (getting annoyed) I know the laws of the night.   I state there is still time  for yet another. PRINCESS OF DARKNESS (forcefully) I would have time for my  own pleasures!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL (angrily) Your own pleasure comes only  after mine, when I desire it.   I am the Sole Ruler of the  Dark World.  There is no one  to challenge my authority here.   My word is the law--all powerful.   No one is to challenge that  authority, no one!.  Is that  understood?  It is my command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS I understand, Master

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL Then see that it does not  happen again, in the penalty of  Everlasting Despair.  Now are  there others?  PRINCESS OF DARKNESS There are others.  CRISWELL Well then let us proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness snaps her fingers three times,  summoning the Zombie Dance Girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS She lived as a zombie in life,  so she will remain forever a  zombie in death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ZOMBIE DANCE GIRL dances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB Easy, Shirley.  Easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Zombie Dance concludes.  PRINCESS OF DARKNESS The moon sinks lower into the  hills!  We must hurry to the  finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL I will decide the conclusion.  PRINCESS OF DARKNESS (impatiently) You had the mummy cancel all  the others scheduled for this  session.  CRISWELL (interrupting) Then cancel my order.  PRINCESS OF DARKNESS The moon is almost gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL There is yet time.  Don't  you want your own pleasure?  PRINCESS OF DARKNESS Oh, if there is only time!  CRISWELL Hahh, there is always time... All in good time...there is  always time.  You shall  have your pleasure.  THAT... I decree  PRINCESS OF DARKNESS (looking at Shirley) All others were but infinitessimal  bits of fluff, compared to her (toward the Dancer) This one would have died for feathers, furs, and fluff...and  so she did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FLUFF DANCE Girl dances for approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fluff Dance ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criswell looks over at the Princess of Darkness. CRISWELL The time...is short.  PRINCESS OF DARKNESS For what!?!  CRISWELL Your pleasures of course!  PRINCESS OF DARKNESS You mean...!  CRISWELL You may take her now.  PRINCESS OF DARKNESS Is there time?  CRISWELL You better hope there is.  PRINCESS OF DARKNESS Thank you, Master!  Thank  you.  CRISWELL Now hurry, hurry.  I will  watch!  Your desires may be  my pleasure also...Our fitting  climax to an evening's enter- tainment.  You must...hurry  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness begins ceremoniously dancing wit her long sacrificial dagger, slowly moving toward shirley gazing back at Criswell seductively.  She finally gets to Shirley and cuts the button off of Shirley's shirt, which was so tight it was about to burst open anyway.  She unsn the front of Shirley's bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob sees his chance and makes his attempt at a "move," me stepping forward.  He is instantly hammer-fisted on the b of the neck by The Wolf Man, and falls down unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess of Darkness raises her long dagger high abov Shirley's head.  But suddenly, the sun rises (it is alrea high overhead), and the night creatures lose their power. Princess of Darkness clings to Shirley's arm, as she slow sinks down to the ground, losing all strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camera pans around, showing Shirley and Bob's faces, back to the ghouls, all of whom have turned to steaming  skeletons.  Only their clothing and bones remain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick Zoom in on Criswell's throne.  Criswell's steaming  skeleton still sits, surveying the cemetery, wearing his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the clearing in the woods near the car wreck, Bob and  Shirley are lying on their backs on the ground, just as t were after the crash, before they got up to investigate t strange music that led them to the ghouls. There are two DOCTORS examining Bob and Shirley. In the foreground, we see a REPORTER's shoulder and hands He is writing down details of the accident in a small pap pad. DOCTOR #1 Easy, Miss, everything's  gonna be alright. SHIRLEY Bob?  Bob? DOCTOR #1 He's right here beside you.  He'll be alright too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporter walks around and crouches beside Shirley and DOCTOR #1, and continues writing in his pad. A Newspaper PHOTOGRAPHER crouches in the foreground to ge shot of the accident scene and victims. SHIRLEY Where are they, where did  they go? They tried to kill  me. DOCTOR #2 What's this you say?  Who  was going to kill you? SHIRLEY The ghouls--they all turned  into skeletons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR #2 Take it easy, Miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR #1 What she needs is a good rest. SHIRLEY It's true, I tell you, it's  true!  They all turned into  skeletons.  She-she cut me  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shirley points to her abdomen where The Princess of Darkn had made the X with her fingernail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NURSE crouches down and pulls out a length of medical tap then hands it to the doctor.  She cuts another piece of tape, but the Doctors don't realize this and leave her hanging...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR #1 Probably was bruised in the  crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR #2 You know, you two were very  lucky. SHIRLEY I love you Bob. I really do.   Forgive me? BOB There's nothing to forgive.  It was all a dream. SHIRLEY You love me then? BOB Of course I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors put Shirley onto a stretcher while the photog takes more pictures.  They put her into the back of an  ambulance. Then after the doctor listens to Bob's neck with a stetho Bob just gets up and walks into the back of the ambulance CRISWELL (VO) As it is with all the Night  People, they are destroyed  by the first rays of the sun.  But upon the first appearance of the deep shadows of the  night, and when the moon is  full, they will return, to  rejoice...in their evil lust,  and take back with them any  mortal who might happen along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criswell is back in his coffin, sitting upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRISWELL Yes, they were lucky, those two  young people...May you be so  lucky...But do not trust to  luck, at the full of the moon,  when the night is dark...Make  a wide path around the unholy  grounds...of the Night People. Who can say that we do not exist-Can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now, we return to our  graves, and you (pointing at audience)  may join us soon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criswell reclines back into his coffin, crossing his arms returning to the slumber of the undead. THE END.

dialogues.speaker: DANCES IN ORDER OF APPEARANCE IN THE FILM
dialogues.text: 1.        Indian Dance...............BUNNY GLASER (Fire) 2.        Street Walker Dance......COLEEN O'BRIEN 3.        Gold Girl Dance...........PAT BARRINGER (Also S 4.        Cat Dance...................TEXAS STARR 5.        Slave Dance..............NADEJDA DOBREV (Ancien 6.        Mexican Dance...........STEPHANIE JONES (Skulls 7.        Hawaiian Dance.............MICKEY JINES (Snakes 8.        Skeleton Dance...........BARBARA NORDIN (Murder 9.        Zombie Dance...............DENE STARNES 10.        Fluff Dance................RENE DE BEAU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transcribed by Jake Royal back
